link.title: Fairport Central School District

meta.content: Our district serves a residential community in Perinton, southeast of metropolitan Rochester, NY. With a commitment to high standards and excellence, faculty and staff, residents, and the Board of Education work collaboratively to enhance student achievement and the quality of educational opportunities. Programs, services, and activities are organized to promote the successful development of the …

Our community is a suburb of Rochester, NY.","potentialAction":[{"@type":"SearchAction","target":"https://fairport.org/?s={search_term_string}","query-input":"required name=search_term_string"}]},{"@type":"ImageObject","@id":"https://fairport.org/#primaryimage","inLanguage":"en-US","url":"https://fairport.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/When-you-see-something-say-something-we-care-1.png","width":200,"height":154,"caption":"When You See Something Say Something We Care"},{"@type":"WebPage","@id":"https://fairport.org/#webpage","url":"https://fairport.org/","name":"Fairport Central School District","isPartOf":{"@id":"https://fairport.org/#website"},"inLanguage":"en-US","primaryImageOfPage":{"@id":"https://fairport.org/#primaryimage"},"datePublished":"2017-05-09T20:04:40+00:00","dateModified":"2020-03-16T14:21:47+00:00","potentialAction":[{"@type":"ReadAction","target":["https://fairport.org/"]}]}]}

” We believe in educating every child
and the whole child. “

a.title: New to the district or need to update your information?

sow-slider-image sow-slider-image-cover
sow-slider-image sow-slider-image-cover
sow-slider-image sow-slider-image-cover

div.p: These projects will address facilities planning – and the future of its educational programming – while maintaining fiscal responsibility. The goal of the future capital improvement project is to best serve our students, faculty and community with necessary updates to infrastructure and learning spaces.

li.class: sow-slider-image sow-slider-image-cover
sow-slider-image sow-slider-image-cover

h3.b: The Strategic Initiatives, finalized in Spring 2018, focus on these priorities:

li.class: sow-slider-image sow-slider-image-cover
sow-slider-image sow-slider-image-cover
sow-slider-image sow-slider-image-cover
sow-slider-image sow-slider-image-cover
sow-slider-image sow-slider-image-cover

p.span: Our district serves a residential community in Perinton, southeast of metropolitan Rochester, NY. With a commitment to high standards and excellence, faculty and staff, residents, and the Board of Education work collaboratively to enhance student achievement and the quality of educational opportunities. Programs, services, and activities are organized to promote the successful development of the skills, concepts, and self-assurance of all students. Contemporary technologies are utilized so that students and staff have 24/7 access to Internet-based communication, collaboration, and learning resources. A hallmark of the District is the caring community.

article.class: news-article post-17512 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-budget category-community category-district-wide category-parents category-superintendent

div.h4: A Call to Action: Need for Federal Funding to Support Public Schools

div.p: It is a privilege to serve our families during the COVID-19 school closure. For the past six weeks the Fairport Central School District has provided technology resources to support online learning activities, social-emotional support to some of our students and over 10,000 breakfast and lunch meals to those in need.

article.class: news-article post-17487 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-community category-fairport-high-school

div.h4: Fairport High School recognized in 2020 U.S. News & World Report Best High School Rankings

div.p: Fairport High School is one of the best in the nation according to the annual U.S. News & World Report’s 2020 Best High Schools Rankings released on Tuesday, April 21, 2020.
The publication evaluated more than 17,700 public high schools across the country. According to the report, Fairport High School ranked 1,296 on the list of best schools in the country,

article.class: news-article post-17480 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-board-of-education category-budget category-community category-district-wide category-parents category-superintendent

div.h4: Instruction & Total Draft #2 Budget with Revenues presented to Board, April 21

div.p: Superintendent of Schools Brett Provenzano and Assistant Superintendent for Business Matt Stevens presented the instruction and total budget draft #2 with revenues to the Board of Education at its Board of Education Meeting, April 21, 2020.
“The Board of Education, in conjunction with District administration, has been re-examining the 2020-21 school budget as a result of the world pandemic and economic pause.

article.class: news-article post-17317 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-board-of-education category-budget category-community category-district-wide

div.h4: Board Meeting Streamed LIVE April 21 at 6 p.m.

div.p: ​Board Meeting Streamed LIVE April 21 at 6 p.m.​

Join us for the District’s next Board of Education Meeting on YouTube or Facebook Live on April 21 at 6 p.m. Superintendent Brett Provenzano and Assistant Superintendent for Business Matthew Stevens will discuss the 2020-21 budget. Please use the Facebook messaging feature to share your thoughts on the topics being discussed so we understand what is on your mind.

article.class: news-article post-17446 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-district-wide category-safety-security

div.p: A video was recently brought to the Fairport Central School District’s attention depicting inappropriate content that was shared during online learning. The District is reviewing this and will appropriately address the matter. The District will also take appropriate actions moving forward to verify that our secure District online platforms and protocols are utilized in this new online environment.

img.alt: When You See Something Say Something We Care

div.span:
This website is maintained by the Fairport Central School District’s Community Relations and Technology Services departments.
It is the goal of the District that the information on this website be accessible to individuals with visual, hearing or cognitive disabilities. Good faith efforts have been made to ensure that our site complies with New York State standards on website accessibility.
However, if you are unable to access or use any aspect of this site, please Submit the Accessibility Reporting Form so that we may provide you with alternative means of access or use. Please note, however, that the District is not responsible for facts or opinions contained on any linked site.

b.a:
The Fairport Central School District will remain CLOSED until at least May 15, 2020 due to New York State Governor Cuomo's order in response to COVID-19. All District buildings and grounds are CLOSED until further notice, including all playgrounds and athletic facilities.
CLICK HERE FOR NEWEST April 24, 2020 MESSAGE.
